stimulusHtml: The beam of monochromatic light is replaced with a beam of light that consists of two different wavelengths, one with wavelength 34位 and one with wavelength 43位. Will the interference pattern on the screen be the same as the pattern with monochromatic light? Why or why not?

features.html: Students project a beam of monochromatic light of wavelength 位 through two slits a distance d apart. An interference pattern is projected on a screen a distance L from the slits.

choicesHtml: Yes , because the interference pattern does not depend on wavelength
Yes, because the average wavelength is still 位
No, because there will be two superimposed interference patterns, each with different distances between maxima
No, because the light with different wavelengths will cancel each other and there will be no interference pattern
